meanings.definition: In a black or dark manner.
meanings.sent1: The night sky shone blackly above us.
meanings.sent2: The cave was blackly lit by a single torch.
meanings.sent3: Despite the sunny day, the room was lit blackly by the closed curtains.
meanings.sent4: His mood was as blackly as the storm clouds gathering overhead.
meanings.sent5: The shadow crept blackly across the wall, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: In a gloomy or pessimistic manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked blackly at the rainy weather forecast.
meanings.sent2: The old house stood blackly on the hill, giving off an ominous vibe.
meanings.sent3: Even the cheerful song sounded blackly when sung by the grumpy cat.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts swirled blackly in his mind, clouding his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The news of the failed mission hung blackly over the team, dampening their spirits.
